description: In a private meeting, Vera provides Reformers with detailed insights on using language to foster public engagement and drive transparency narratives.
Reformers participate in a public forum, effectively advocating for greater transparency, sparking citywide discussions and capturing media attention.
Internal resistance grows as Reformers document systemic flaws and propose actionable reforms, highlighting the need for structural changes in BCI handling.
Leaked reform documents circulate online, attracting widespread public interest and increasing pressure on the Directorate for transparency.
Public support for Reformers swells as citizens demand the Council address transparency issues within the BCI system.
Reformers issue a report detailing proposed system overhauls, generating media coverage but also facing bureaucratic obstacles and delays.
